properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 26 at 9:57PM PST until January 28 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of Southwest Washington, including
the following areas, South Washington Coast and Willapa Hills.

* From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon

* Heavy rain is expected in the Willapa Hills Monday afternoon
into Monday night. Expected rainfall of one and a half to three
inches will cause sharp rises, and may be enough to cause
flooding of small streams and rivers draining out of the Willapa
Hills.

* The river with the greatest concern of flooding is the Grays
River in Wahkiakum County since it responds quickly to excessive
rainfall.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts. Monitor later forecasts and be alert for
possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding
should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

Landslides and debris flows are possible during this flood event.
People, structures and roads located below steep slopes, in
canyons and near the mouths of canyons may be at serious risk
from rapidly moving landslides.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
